name: Commonwealth ex rel. Schnader, Attorney General, Appellant, v. Consolidated Indemnity and Insurance Company
name_abbreviation: Commonwealth ex rel. Schnader v. Consolidated Indemnity & Insurance

judges: Before Maxey, C. J., Linn, Stern, Patterson, Stearns and Jones, JJ.
parties: Commonwealth ex rel. Schnader, Attorney General, Appellant, v. Consolidated Indemnity and Insurance Company.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
The decree is affirmed, at the appellant’s costs, on the opinion of Judge Woodside for the court below.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Ralph B. Umsted, Deputy Attorney General, with him John A. Shelton, Special Deputy Attorney General, James A. Wright, Special Deputy Attorney General and T. McKeen Ghidsey, Attorney General, for appellant.
C. Russell Phillips and Alfred G. Bennett, with them Montgomery, McGrachen, Walher & Rhoads and Isaac Goldstein, for appellee.
Peirce A. Hammond, Jr., with him Caldwell, Fox & Stoner and Harris, Hammond & Harris, for Thomas E. Cahill, amicus curiae.
casebody.head_matter:
Commonwealth ex rel. Schnader, Attorney General, Appellant, v. Consolidated Indemnity and Insurance Company.
Argued May 24, 1949.
Before Maxey, C. J., Linn, Stern, Patterson, Stearns and Jones, JJ.
Ralph B. Umsted, Deputy Attorney General, with him John A. Shelton, Special Deputy Attorney General, James A. Wright, Special Deputy Attorney General and T. McKeen Ghidsey, Attorney General, for appellant.
C. Russell Phillips and Alfred G. Bennett, with them Montgomery, McGrachen, Walher & Rhoads and Isaac Goldstein, for appellee.
Peirce A. Hammond, Jr., with him Caldwell, Fox & Stoner and Harris, Hammond & Harris, for Thomas E. Cahill, amicus curiae.
June 24, 1949:
